links.name: NASA POWER Data Access Viewer
links.description_en: A NASA tool that provides solar, meteorological, and climatological data for any location worldwide, useful for weather and climate studies.

links.name: NASA GPM Data
links.description_en: Provides global precipitation data from the NASA Global Precipitation Measurement (GPM) mission, ideal for rainfall and storm analysis.

links.name: OpenWeatherMap Historical Weather
links.description_en: Offers historical weather data including temperature, precipitation, wind, and more, useful for climate research and forecasting.

links.name: NOAA Climate Data Online
links.description_en: Provides access to NOAA's global and US weather and climate data, including daily and hourly observations, climate normals, and more.

links.name: ECMWF ERA5 Reanalysis
links.description_en: High-resolution global climate reanalysis data from ECMWF, including temperature, precipitation, wind, and atmospheric variables.

links.name: Tornado Web Framework
links.description_en: A Python web framework and asynchronous networking library, originally developed at FriendFeed. By using non-blocking network I/O, Tornado can scale to tens of thousands of open connections, making it ideal for long polling, WebSockets, and other applications that require a long-lived connection to each user.

links.name: OpenWeatherMap Current Weather API
links.description_en: OpenWeatherMap API endpoint to get current weather data for any city worldwide, including temperature, humidity, wind, and weather conditions.
